Pharmacist Job at AfriHealth Limited




        
    

        
        AfriHealth Limited provides personalized, high-quality healthcare necessary to take control of your health with a plethora of patient resources from the comfort of a smartphone. We enhance your well-being by utilizing cutting-edge technology and modern medicine designed for your convenience. Our healthcare platform offers comprehensive care that encompasses diagnosis, medication therapy, and more.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Pharmacist

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking to hire a passionate and result-driven experienced Pharmacist to join the team.


Job Description


	Manage safety and compliance across the system
	Ensure the company complies with all pharmaceutical regulations and industry standards.
	Manage the registration of all products with NAFDAC and ensure that all licenses and certifications are up to date.
	Serve as the point of contact during inspections or audits by regulatory authorities.
	Implement and monitor adherence to quality control protocols
	Train staff on compliance and safety procedures to ensure best practices are followed.


Qualifications


	Bachelor`s degree in Pharmacy.
	3-5 years of experience in regulatory compliance, preferably in pharmaceuticals.
	Strong understanding of NAFDAC, SON, Safety and other regulatory bodies requirements.
	Attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.
	Ability to communicate regulatory requirements clearly to the team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: pmarecruitment01@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only suitable candidates will be contacted, let’s build something great together!

Accounts Auditor Job at St. Mary Dedication British International High Schools




        
    

        
        St. Mary Dedication British International High  Schools is a renowned educational institution known for its academic excellence and morally upright students. St Mary Dedication British international school challenges students to develop what is finest in themselves and others, for others and themselves. We are committed to nurturing an intentionally diverse, and inclusive community that encourages students and adults to inspire and respect one another. 
     

            
    



At St Mary Dedication British Internation school our guiding principle is Education for Light, Through  Knowledge. Our aim is to provide a richness of opportunity for our student to excel, nurture and explore their talents without limits. That is because education goes beyond exam results, its about the complete development of the child.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Title: Accounts Auditor

Location: Benin City, Edo
Employment type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Accounts Auditor to join our team in Benin City, Nigeria. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our financial records and reporting processes.


Responsibilities


	Conduct thorough audits of financial statements, accounting records, and internal control systems
	Analyze financial data to identify discrepancies, inefficiencies, or areas of non-compliance
	Prepare comprehensive audit reports and present findings to management
	Develop and implement audit procedures to improve efficiency and effectiveness
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian financial regulations, tax laws, and international accounting standards
	Collaborate with internal departments to address audit findings and implement corrective actions
	Assist in the preparation of financial statements and reports
	Participate in special projects and investigations as required
	Stay up-to-date with changes in accounting standards and regulatory requirements.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Minimum 3-5 years of experience in accounting or auditing
	Professional certification (e.g., CPA, ACCA) preferred
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP) and advanced Excel skills
	Strong knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) 
	Understanding of Nigerian financial regulations and tax laws
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
	Strong time management and organizational abilities
	Effective communication skills, both written and verbal
	Experience with financial statement preparation and analysis
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Benefits


	Salary is attractive 
	Pension 
	Opportunities for professional growth.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job brief


	We are looking for an Accountant to manage all financial transactions, from fixed payments and variable expenses to bank deposits and budgets at our Sagamu Factory.
	The ideal candidate&rsquo;s responsibilities include auditing financial documents and procedures, reconciling bank statements and calculating tax payments and returns.


Responsibilities


	Manage all accounting transactions
	Prepare budget forecasts
	Handle monthly, quarterly and annual closings
	Reconcile accounts payable and receivable
	Ensure timely bank payments
	Compute taxes and prepare tax returns
	Manage balance sheets and profit/loss statements
	Reinforce financial data confidentiality and conduct database backups when necessary
	Comply with financial policies and regulations


Requirements and skills


	BSc in Accounting, Finance or relevant degree
	1-2 years of work experience as an Accountant

	Exceptional talent is rewarded accordingly, and we&rsquo;re open to negotiation.
	Additional sign-on bonus for if able to pass the technical screen and start immediately.

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Finance &amp; Accounts
Reports To: Cost Accountant / Finance Manager

Job Purpose


	The Junior Cost Accountant will support the costing and financial control functions of the company by collecting, analyzing, and reporting cost-related data.
	The role ensures accurate product costing, expense monitoring, and compliance with accounting standards under the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN) framework.
	This position provides key support in decision-making related to pricing, budgeting, and cost efficiency.


Key Responsibilities
Costing &amp; Product Analysis:


	Assist in preparing standard product costing and variance analysis.
	Collect, review, and verify data on material, labor, and overhead costs.
	Monitor inventory levels and support monthly stock valuation exercises.
	Assist in preparing landed cost calculations for imported goods (if applicable).


Budgeting &amp; Forecasting Support:


	Support the preparation of annual budgets and periodic forecasts.
	Monitor actual costs against budgeted figures and report variances.
	Provide cost-related analysis to aid management decision-making.


Expense Monitoring &amp; Control:


	Track departmental expenses and ensure they are within approved budgets.
	Maintain accurate cost records and ensure all expenses are properly allocated.
	Assist in implementing cost reduction initiatives and efficiency improvements.


Reporting &amp; Documentation:


	Assist in preparing monthly cost reports, profitability analysis, and margin reviews.
	Ensure accuracy and completeness of all costing data and documentation.
	Provide costing information to support pricing strategies and business proposals.


Compliance &amp; Audit Support:


	Ensure compliance with ICAN standards, IFRS, and company policies.
	Assist in preparing schedules and supporting documents for internal and external audits.
	Ensure timely filing of reports required by management and regulators.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy and timeliness of cost reports and analysis.
	Variance between standard cost and actual cost.
	Efficiency of cost monitoring and expense tracking.
	Compliance with ICAN, IFRS, and company accounting policies.
	Contribution to cost savings and process improvements.


Job Requirements
Education &amp; Certification:


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	ICAN certification (ACA or in-view) is mandatory.


Experience:


	1&ndash;3 years of experience in cost accounting, management accounting, or finance.
	Experience in FMCG, food manufacturing, or production environment is an advantage.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of cost accounting methods, budgeting, and variance analysis.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (Sage, QuickBooks, SAP, or Tally).
	Analytical and numerical skills with high attention to detail.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Ability to interpret financial data and provide meaningful insights.


Personal Attributes:


	High level of integrity and accountability.
	Proactive, results-oriented, and eager to learn.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure and meet deadlines.


Work Conditions:


	Office-based role with frequent interaction with operations, procurement, and warehouse teams.
	May involve extended hours during month-end, year-end, or audit periods.


Method of Application

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Cost Accountant
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Finance & Accounts
Reports To: Cost Accountant / Finance Manager

Job Purpose
     

            
    




	The Junior Cost Accountant will support the costing and financial control functions of the company by collecting, analyzing, and reporting cost-related data.
	The role ensures accurate product costing, expense monitoring, and compliance with accounting standards under the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN) framework.
	This position provides key support in decision-making related to pricing, budgeting, and cost efficiency.


Key Responsibilities
Costing & Product Analysis:


	Assist in preparing standard product costing and variance analysis.
	Collect, review, and verify data on material, labor, and overhead costs.
	Monitor inventory levels and support monthly stock valuation exercises.
	Assist in preparing landed cost calculations for imported goods (if applicable).


Budgeting & Forecasting Support:


	Support the preparation of annual budgets and periodic forecasts.
	Monitor actual costs against budgeted figures and report variances.
	Provide cost-related analysis to aid management decision-making.


Expense Monitoring & Control:


	Track departmental expenses and ensure they are within approved budgets.
	Maintain accurate cost records and ensure all expenses are properly allocated.
	Assist in implementing cost reduction initiatives and efficiency improvements.


Reporting & Documentation:


	Assist in preparing monthly cost reports, profitability analysis, and margin reviews.
	Ensure accuracy and completeness of all costing data and documentation.
	Provide costing information to support pricing strategies and business proposals.


Compliance & Audit Support:


	Ensure compliance with ICAN standards, IFRS, and company policies.
	Assist in preparing schedules and supporting documents for internal and external audits.
	Ensure timely filing of reports required by management and regulators.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy and timeliness of cost reports and analysis.
	Variance between standard cost and actual cost.
	Efficiency of cost monitoring and expense tracking.
	Compliance with ICAN, IFRS, and company accounting policies.
	Contribution to cost savings and process improvements.


Job Requirements
Education & Certification:


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	ICAN certification (ACA or in-view) is mandatory.


Experience:


	1–3 years of experience in cost accounting, management accounting, or finance.
	Experience in FMCG, food manufacturing, or production environment is an advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of cost accounting methods, budgeting, and variance analysis.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (Sage, QuickBooks, SAP, or Tally).
	Analytical and numerical skills with high attention to detail.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Ability to interpret financial data and provide meaningful insights.


Personal Attributes:


	High level of integrity and accountability.
	Proactive, results-oriented, and eager to learn.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure and meet deadlines.


Work Conditions:


	Office-based role with frequent interaction with operations, procurement, and warehouse teams.
	May involve extended hours during month-end, year-end, or audit periods.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume along with a Cover Letter to: hr@afripointgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
